TextBlock.Text: CALAD: Walking through this place makes me miss the open night sky. Remind me to add some exterior area on future iterations, please.
PRIMM: I share the feeling, Calad. Perhaps a garden could be made, or an observatory?
MELINA: I’m unsure that’d be enough, Primm. Hypothesis: Making a facsimile of the sky will not suffice; only the true version will satiate our love for it.
CALAD: That’s not a comforting hypothesis, Melina. Why do you believe that?
MELINA: I lack concrete evidence, but I cannot think of a situation where, knowing I’m looking at code and algorithms, I’d be satisfied.
CALAD: Perhaps… Perhaps I feel the same.
MELINA: Let us search for the other Anchors; we should assure ourselves they all function well. We’ll head for the center afterwards.
